greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Factorial expansion of Gamma(1/4) = Sum_{n>=1} a(n)/n! with largest possible a(n), and Gamma = Euler's gamma function.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for factorial base representation
formula: a(n) = floor(n!*Gamma(1/4)) - n*floor((n-1)!*Gamma(1/4)), for n > 1. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 26 2018
mathematica: r:= Gamma[1/4]; Table[If[n == 1, Floor[r], Floor[n!*r]- n*Floor[(n-1)!*r] ], {n,1,100}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 29 2018 *)
program: (PARI) default(realprecision, 250); b = gamma(1/4); for(n=1, 80, print1(if(n==1, floor(b), floor(n!*b) - n*floor((n-1)!*b)), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Mar 29 2018
(MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(250));  [Floor(Gamma(1/4))] cat [Floor(Factorial(n)*Gamma(1/4)) - n*Floor(Factorial((n-1))*Gamma(1/4)) : n in [2..80]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2018
[A068464(n) for n in (1..80)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 27 2018
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Mar 10 2002
